title: SEC Considering New Rules on Private-Fund Fees, Conflicts, Gensler Says
sub_head: The SEC chairman expressed concern about high fees, lack of transparency and fuzzy performance metrics at private-equity and hedge funds
body:
Wall Streetâ€™s top regulator is considering new rules to bring sunshine to the private-funds market, including more disclosure about fees and conflicts of interest.
Securities and Exchange Commission Chairman Gary Gensler said Wednesday he has asked agency staff for proposals to reform what he sees as a slate of troublesome practices by private-equity and hedge-fund managers. These include the use of unclear performance metrics and opacity in fees and expenses charged to investors.
